metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5801 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An error within the "LibRaw::unpack()" function (src/libraw_cxx.cpp) inLibRaw versions prior to 0.18.7 can be exploited to trigger a NULL pointerdereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5801` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.2
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libraw package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.17.1-1ubuntu0.2').
ufraw package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
darktable package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
rawtherapee package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
